intro: Consolida divaricata, commonly known as the sweet pea or garden sweet pea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in temperate climates. The plant features climbing stems that twine around supports, and its foliage consists of pinnately compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. It produces clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers in a variety of colors, including pink, red, and white. The seeds are enclosed in elongated pods that split open when mature, dispersing the seeds by wind.
